ai.summary: Farleitter Crag Trail is a 7.7 km moderate hike in the UK. The route traverses varied terrain with potential rocky sections, short ascents, and scenic views from craggy outlooks. Suitable for walkers with some experience and good footwear who enjoy a steady pace and outdoor scenery.
ai.terrain_summary: The route combines grassy paths, rocky steps, and occasional damp or boggy patches. Expect uneven footing near crags, gentle to moderate elevation change, and some exposed sections where weather can affect visibility and footing.
ai.safety_notes: Plan for rapidly changing UK weather: bring waterproofs and extra layers. Stay on marked paths, keep away from cliff edges and unstable ledges, and watch footing on wet rock. Carry a map or GPS, a fully charged phone, and a whistle. Let someone know your plans and expected return. Bring sufficient water and snacks; consider a headlamp if you may finish after dusk.
recommended_gear: Extra layers (fleece, hat, gloves in cold weather)
Headlamp or flashlight (in case of getting delayed)
ai.best_seasons: Spring to autumn (roughly March to October) in the UK is typically best for this trail, offering longer daylight and generally drier conditions, though weather can still be changeable.
